result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley Trevor Quaderer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley Trevor Quaderer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: request to issue civil Judgement for Court and Obligations and/or Restitution received and forwarded to Ali. os

Defendant Bradley Trevor Quaderer in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 10 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.

Defendant Bradley Trevor Quaderer in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
cab
The case is calendared for a jury trial today.
The defendant wants to change his plea.
 Defendant waived  rights and pled guilty.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights and Elements of Criminal Offenses - Felonies received and filed.
Defendant examined as to his plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Judgment of Conviction entered.
.
Sentencing continued...
.
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for -0- days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 14 months, concurrent,  with the following conditions:

- Complete a course in anger management.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at $90.10.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Court ordered bail set at $200.00 cash.  Defense requests a disposition date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 36.
No contact order signed and served on the defendant in court.
Case adjourned for a plea and sentencing in Branch 36.

Defendant Bradley Trevor Quaderer in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of maximum penalties and right to counsel.  Complaint given to defendant's attorney.    Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
